question: Which of the following time signatures have standard notation? <image 1>
description:
The image displays four musical notations labeled A, B, C, and D. Each notation includes a time signature and a sequence of notes:

- **A.** The time signature is 12/8. The notation consists of a dotted quarter note followed by an eighth note tied to another eighth note, then a quarter note.
  
- **B.** The time signature is 12/8. The notation shows a quarter note followed by an eighth note tied to another eighth note, then a dotted quarter note.
  
- **C.** The time signature is 6/8. The notation includes two eighth notes with a rest in between them.
  
- **D.** The time signature is 12/8. The notation features a quarter note followed by an eighth note tied to another eighth note, then a dotted quarter note.

The question asks which of the given time signatures have standard notation. The options provided are combinations of these labels (A, B, C, D). 

To determine the correct answer, one needs to identify which time signatures among 12/8 and 6/8 are considered standard in musical notation.
